data.title: Excellent Hotel and Location
data.text: Stayed here one night for business.  One of the few times I have really wished I could have stayed longer at a business hotel.  Free (current) DVD movies, room was large with a nice kitchenette.  Clean, no odd smells, comfy bed, and carpet that looked fairly new.  Building was very secure (had to ring in or use card to enter).  There were also games and appliances available for checkout.  Clearly intended as an extended stay set up but just fine or the night.  Great value.  The only hitch in my entire stay was a bit of traffic noise starting at about 3:00 a.m.  Recommend you bring earplugs if you are a light sleeper or perhaps it was just a certain side.  (I was in 412).

data.title: Very large rooms for the price
data.text:
We had ground floor room which was great for us- no lift. 

The rooms are very large and have a full refrigerator and a small cooking top and a microwave with cutlery. You can buy basic breakfast and food stuff at the store on the ground floor if you wish as there is no breakfast.  We did not mind no breakfast as sometimes we do not wish to have.

A small pool at the front which is nice and paid parking available. Used the free laundry which was great and ice on every floor- just take your ice holder  from the freezer in the fridge and use that- no problems.

They do have a safety deposit box if you need to use but no room safe, but we were unable to use this facility as we arrived on a Sunday and only the manager has a key and he was not on duty till Monday.

Staff on reception very nice and location is good within easy walking distance to restaurants.

data.title: Average at best.
data.text: The hotel is conveniently located within walking distance of most downtown attractions.   It has convenient parking behind the hotel, at a price of $8 a night.   It is attractive outside with a small swimming pool and covered patio.    I was disappointed with the room.   First, there was only one recliner and a desk chair to sit on.   Second, the bed was pushed almost against the wall, making access for two difficult.    Third, there was no ice bucket.   In all my many years at a hotel, this is the first time there was no ice bucket.   The front desk suggested I use a Tupperware container in the room's cabinets or get the ice maker's ice bin in the refrigerator.   On the positive, the room was a decent size and clean.   It has a refrigerator, 2 stove cooking services, a microwave and some cooking ware, utensils and plates.    Another disappointment was the hotel does not offer a complimentary breakfast.   Instead, it has a small store where you can buy various items.   None appealed to me.

data.title: Great Wheelchair-Accessible Room (See photos)
data.text:

data.title: Weekend Special Event
data.text:
New review. Deleted first review and wanted to add additional information. Drove up from Saint  Augustine Florida to attend my 50th High School class reunion. Chose the Candlewood Suites because of location and great value. I am and IHG Platinum Elite member and always try to use the IHG group of hotels when I travel. This hotel is centrally located to all areas of downtown Mobile.  It is extremely clean , great pay for parking, very conveniently located outdoor pool with BBQ grills for your use as a guest, good workout room, laundry area and small general store. As a Platinum Elite member I was upgraded to a one bedroom suite on the first floor. Found the room clean and very spacious. This hotel is perfect for families traveling as the Suites are a small one-bedroom apartment with full kitchens completely furnished. This hotel is located just one hour from Gulf Shores Alabama one of the Gulf Coast Premier Beach. Plenty of restaurants within walking distance of this hotel. The staff at the front desk was very nice, and very efficient. Cyn.... was the young lady that checked me in and she acknowledged my Platinum Elite status and could not be more efficient.
I totally recommend this hotel if you want to be in Downtown Mobile for pleasure or for business.

data.title: I think this hotel is underrated. Candlewood Suites Downtown Mobile
data.text:
We stayed here April 14th thru the 17th, 2016. We were in the area for a dance competition. It was close to where we needed to be.

This place is not fancy but clean, the staff polite and friendly, and we loved the overall size of the room, the full kitchen, some full size appliances we shopped before arrival)  - other then the stove and the coffee pot is small, dishes, a few pots, a little utensils to cook with and enough utensils to eat with, dish soap, a small amount of dish washing soap, one roll of paper towel, etc. is included and you can ask the staff for more, then ample storage space and seating space for us four. You can borrow small appliances from a cabinet in the lobby like a crock pot, waffle iron, etc..  There is a seperate living area from the bedroom which was kind of small but was adequate for us and you could also sit at the ample, long counter in the kitchen. The place was quiet.  The bed and couch was comfortable. The bathroom had ample space for moving around, enough towels though the counter top area was small. 

There is a small and limited parking area behind the building Self parking fee: USD 8.00 per day and they do have additional parking across the street. Ask at the front desk and they will give you a parking ticket. Park in the lighted numbered areas and spots. The parking lot is old, which is fine but looks questionable at night. We were fine but play it safe. 

We did not use the BBQ Grill, the pool, fitness area, the laundry facility or get a free newspaper. We just didn't need them. Pets are allowed and there is a charge. Call ahead for pet requirements.

We did buy items from the little hotels grocery store inside the lobby. There was bananas, yohurt, cereals, milk, water, other drinks and other stuff. It was kind of expensive but convenient since we shopped at Publix in Daphne first before heading downtown and did not get any breakfast items. For some reason I thought breakfast was included with our hotel. It is not. There is free coffee. But, you can make it in your room if you wish.

 We would stay here again and recommend the place. Good value for the money and close to places to see in the downtown area and not far from other areas or even Daphne. It was about a 20 min. drive or so on a week end from Daphne to this hotel. Unless there is an event going on.
